ecided on:                       26.03.2024

M
OHAMMED LAFFAR, J.
This is an Appeal preferred by the Respondent-Petitioner-Appellant (hereinafter
referred to as the Appellant) from the Order of the learned High Court Judge of
Ratnapura dated 25-05-2017.

The 
Applicant-Respondent-Respondent
Respondent), the Competent Authority, in terms of the provisions of the State
Lands  (Recovery  of  Possession)  Act  No.  7  of  1979  (as  amended),  instituted
proceedings
column2: in  the  Magistrate’s  Court  of  Ratnapura  against  the  Appellant

column1: praying, inter-alia,  for an Order of ejectment of the Appellant from the land in
dispute. After inquiry, the learned Magistrate on 27-05-2011 made an Order for
ejectment.  Being  aggrieved  by
column2:
the  said  Order, 
the  Appellant 
invoked 
the

column1: revisionary jurisdiction of the Provincial High Court of Ratnapura and whereas
the learned High Court Judge of Ratnapura on 25-05-2017 dismissed the said
revision application. It is against that Order, the instant Appeal is preferred by
the Appellant.
The grounds of Appeal advanced by the learned Counsel for the Appellant reads
thus;

column2: 1.  Since the land in dispute is owned by the Land Reform Commission, the
Respondent  has  no  right  to  issue  a  notice  under  Section  3  of  the  State
Lands (Recovery of Possession) Act No. 7 of 1979 (as amended).
2.  The Appellant is in possession of the subject matter with leave and license

column1: of the Land Reform Commission.
3.  The subject matter is not properly identified.
In terms of Section 3 of the said Act, the Competent Authority is empowered to
issue notices on the unauthorized occupants for the recovery of  possession of
any State lands, which reads thus;

column2: “Where  a  competent  authority  is  of  the  opinion  that  any  person  is  in
unauthorized  possession  or  occupation  of  any  State  land  the  competent
authority  may  serve  a  notice  on  such  person  in  possession  or  occupation
